title: @Meddler, Ez is the only champ really who uses Muramana, are there any plans for the item?
body:
The item has become outdated because a lot of its user have been reworked in a manner that they don't need the item anymore. Ez is the only known champ who still uses it. The item itself is decent as it doesn't require other items to power spike. For example, crit needs multiple crit items to work. Muramana works on its own, but has a long stack time while not seeming worth while when compared to crit/lethality. It also gets weaker in long fights. The cons seems to outweigh the pros.

I would like to see the item appeal to more champs as I think it is unique in its single target/on hit damage. I would also love to see mages use it. Adding a hard cap to the number of times it can be proc'ed per second will prevent champs from completely abusing it with a multiple single targeted cast or spells that can proc like over 5 times per second.

So Meddler, can you pls let us know if riot is even looking at this item? I would like to see it in the meta again.

I wouldn't say it has exactly 'the same' problem.
Archangel mostly has the issue of beeing to delayed in it's power in a heavily earlygame focused meta(since S6 pretty much) and morellos beeing to dominant as mana option.

Muramana has a whole much more issues. It's passive only works well with frequent singletarget damage, while most ADs that need mana have AOE abillities, that alone limits the number of potential users quite alot, as you need either spamable singletarget spells or High AS while wanting that mana to spam spells, which really aren#t much champs.
On top of that, Muramana has a kinda identity crisis, the costs and stats of it make it an early/mid items, yet the stacking mechanic makes it a mid-late item, which results with it only giving a brief powerspike duering mid once it transforms, and then it falls of due to the lowish stats for the slot.
However, my bigest issue with it is that it drains your manapool like crazy **and it gets weaker the less current mana you have**. The reason for why this is such an issue to me is simple: If i go for mana, i do so to stay effective even in prolonged fights instead of running oom, and the muramana effect directly goes against that.
Another issue is that there are few mana items that you would combine with it, which further limits it's scaleing. You'll hardly see more mana than a trinity or iceborn on top of it.

So even with out the stacking issue, muramana would still be a flawed item that isn't very statisfying to get, while AA is a quite a nice item with quite some other mana/ap options for the synergie

Are you an AD champion who's damage comes almost only (70% at least) from abilities, and who maybe likes to scale into late game? Take manamune.

I think a core issue with it is that it's clearly designed for the AD spellcaster, and typically those come in 2 design directions.

1) The snowball bursty assassin/fighter types who want damage quick and directly, which Muramana doesn't assist much with, or

2) The AOE ranged caster, who would only benefit from its passive on AA effects, and so would need more raw damage from the item itself, but Muramana essentially caps at around 65 AD (for most champs considering 1000 base mana at 18) with no other utility to it.  In contrast, Duskblade may give 10 less AD, but it also gives CDR, Lethality, and a passive that does damage faster, as opposed to the sustained damage of Muramana.  

Basically, it's got a bit of an identity crisis where its intended goal for given champions can be achieved with other items that may be more expensive, but give better stats, and fewer conditions.

Also to contrast it with its AP counterpart {{item:3040}} , at least this item you can objectively say gives the most potential AP of any other item counting just itself.
